tap.upload

Class Uploader

  • java.lang.Object
    • tap.upload.Uploader

  • public class Uploader
extends java.lang.Object

    Let create properly given VOTable inputs in the "database".

    This class manages particularly the upload limit in rows and in bytes by creating a LimitedTableIterator with a VOTableIterator.

    Version:
    2.0 (04/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)
    See Also:
    LimitedTableIterator, VOTableIterator

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected DBConnection dbConn
      Connection to the "database" (which lets upload the content of any given VOTable).
      protected int limit
      Limit on the number of rows or bytes (depending of limitUnit) allowed to be uploaded in once (whatever is the number of tables).
      protected ServiceConnection.LimitUnit limitUnit
      Type of limit to set: ROWS or BYTES.
      protected int nbRows
      Number of rows already loaded.
      protected ServiceConnection service
      Specification of the TAP service.
      protected TAPSchema uploadSchema
      Description of the TAP_UPLOAD schema to use.

        Parameters:
        service - Specification of the TAP service using this uploader.

    • Method Detail

      • upload

        public TAPSchema upload(DALIUpload[] uploads)
                 throws TAPException

        Upload all the given VOTable inputs.

        Note: The TAPTable objects representing the uploaded tables will be associated with the TAP_UPLOAD schema specified at the creation of this Uploader. If no such schema was specified, a default one (whose DB name will be equals to the ADQL name, that's to say TAPMetadata.STDSchema.UPLOADSCHEMA) is created, will be associated with the uploaded tables and will be returned by this function.

        Parameters:
        uploads - Array of tables to upload.
        Returns:
        A TAPSchema containing the list and the description of all uploaded tables.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while reading the VOTable inputs or while uploading the table into the "database".
        See Also:
        DBConnection.addUploadedTable(TAPTable, tap.data.TableIterator)
